result.execSummary:
The defendant Maleik Oshae Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for work, child care, medical treatment.

miscConds.notes:
No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
No contact with CAH. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.

AODA assessment & any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with monitored by drug testing & breathalyzer testing.

Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy & taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
Successfully complete anger management course.

Provide a DNA sample.
Pay mandatory costs, fees and all applicable surcharges (including the DNA and DV surcharge) and assessments, to be collected during the term of probation. Any unpaid amount to convert to civil judgment.
Restitution is set at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maleik Oshae Anderson

records.addlTxt: of Representation by Attorney Ruby De Leon, filed.

Defendant Maleik Oshae Anderson in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Maleik Oshae Anderson. Defendant Maleik Oshae Anderson in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Maleik Oshae Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1:  Defendant  advised that if s/he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms (body armor); also defendant is advised s/he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders charge dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties. 

As to Count 1:  The court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, 2 days credit for time served, Huber for work, child care, medical treatment.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
- AODA assessment & any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with monitored by drug testing & breathalyzer testing.
- Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy & taking any prescribed medications.
- Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
- Successfully complete anger management course.
- Complete 20 hours of community service.
- No contact with CAH. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment.
- Pay mandatory costs, fees and all applicable surcharges (including the DNA and DV surcharge) and assessments, to be collected during the term of probation. Any unpaid amount to convert to civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at zero.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Maleik Oshae Anderson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Maleik Oshae Anderson in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Maleik Oshae Anderson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Case retabbed due to alleged victim in case.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.
